Pre-Game Insights: The two franchises are mirror images of ineptitude — junior teams in baseball-mad cities, long saddled with cheapskate owners and a tendency to underachieve when not outright tanking — playing a game where even the winner was still going to be an all-time loser.
Post-Match Reflections: The face-offs of futility between the White Sox and Angels aren’t over: They’re scheduled for three games in Chicago next week.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game ended — when else? — in the 13th inning, on yet another single deflected off the glove of a White Sox infielder.
Nolan Schanuel of the Angels jumps over teammate Jack López in a game against the White Sox at Angel Stadium on Wednesday.
Taylor Ward singled off the glove of White Sox shortstop Nicky Lopez. The score was now 1-1.
The White Sox scored in the 10th and 11th; so did the Angels.
A group of Chicago White Sox fans react as their team loses to the Los Angeles Angels 4-3 in 13 innings on Wednesday at Angel Stadium.
